channel.title: Connections Problems
channel.description:
Well, I'm using Garbo's Source and Client, and I changed all of Garboscape.no-ip.biz to my NO-IP, and I leave everything else. I've been just trying to connect, forget everything else D:. Sorry, I'm a noob. I open No-IP, then I go to server, and click run. Then I go to the client, and start that. I try to log in, but I get an error. Can somebody tell me what I'm doing wrong? By the way, please don't give me any of that google.com crap.
Edit: I can't just change the client ip, I have to go into the files and change it.

item.title: Connections Problems
item.dc:creator: @Lahdeedah2 Lahdeedah2
item.description:
@Lahdeedah2 wrote:

OH! Two clients, never though of that. Ugh, I’m so stupid. Thanks. I’ll tell you how that worked out. I don’t have linksys, so no pfing for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Connections Problems
item.dc:creator: @Residence Residence
item.description:
@Residence wrote:

if your connecting to the server on YOUR system log in using localhost / 127.0.0.1
if your connecting to the server on ANOTHER system log in using NO-IP

Make sure you have PF,no-ip checked, and have eddited everything for no-ip, make 2 clients 1 for other people to download witch you would put the ip as your no-ip

and have one client for you witch will change everything to localhost / 127.0.0.1

hope this helped

Read full topic

item.title: Connections Problems
item.dc:creator: @Lahdeedah2 Lahdeedah2
item.description:
@Lahdeedah2 wrote:

Edited. I’m an idiot, sorry. I already did that, and it didn’t work.

You can connect wirelessly, right? I’m using a wireless modem, and I want to host a server on a laptop. Can I do that?

Read full topic

item.title: Connections Problems
item.dc:creator: @Nubcoder Nubcoder
item.description:
@Nubcoder wrote:

If your not a java coder, dont do it but… ill help go in gui.java and there should be spaces saying "garboscape.no-ip.biz , “garboscape.no-ip.biz” , “Garboscape.no-ip.biz” change it to your server ip

Read full topic

item.title: Connections Problems
item.dc:creator: @Lahdeedah2 Lahdeedah2
item.description:
@Lahdeedah2 wrote:

Oh, I don’t use linksys, so that’s not a problem for me.

Edit:

Where exactly to I put that code D:

Edit #2:

The client I have doesn’t let you do that. It’s something in the coding that connects it, or whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: Connections Problems
item.dc:creator: @CarNeY_ReTuRnZ CarNeY ReTuRnZ
item.description:
@CarNeY_ReTuRnZ wrote:

Right, edit the client IP to 127.0.0.1 This is what you will use

Then run the server and try to connect

For other people to connect you put in your own No-ip.

Make sure you have port forward correctly!! (www.portforward.com)

Read full topic

item.title: Connections Problems

item.description:
@Lahdeedah2 wrote:

Well, I’m using Garbo’s Source and Client, and I changed all of Garboscape.no-ip.biz to my NO-IP, and I leave everything else. I’ve been just trying to connect, forget everything else D:. Sorry, I’m a noob. I open No-IP, then I go to server, and click run. Then I go to the client, and start that. I try to log in, but I get an error. Can somebody tell me what I’m doing wrong? By the way, please don’t give me any of that google.com crap.

Edit:
I can’t just change the client ip, I have to go into the files and change it.
